description: Burton miss the chance to restore their five-point lead at the top of League Two after a draw with Stevenage.
title: Burton Albion 1-1 Stevenage
maintext:
Burton missed the chance to restore their five-point lead at the top of League Two as they drew with Stevenage.
The visitors went ahead in the 12th minute when midfielder Tom Naylor found his own net in attempting to clear Simon Walton's header.
Another own goal brought Burton level as Bira Dembele turned John Mousinho's header past keeper Chris Day.
Phil Edwards hit the bar with a header for Burton, who are three points clear of Shrewsbury and Wycombe.
Burton manager Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink told BBC Radio Derby:
"I think in the second half we deserved more out of the game than just a point.
"If you look at the second half, it was all us. We had a few chances and looked like the team to score, but it wasn't meant to be.
"A point is not bad and we move on and we have got to be ready for the next one."
Stevenage boss Graham Westley told BBC Three Counties Radio:
